text: it's incredible what you can do with a
simple dough a mixture of flour water
yeast and salt this one is as basic as
anything the type of dough you'd use for
pizza or plain white bread or rustic
bread and we're going to make a really
nice grilled Middle Eastern style
flatbread with it it's a very typical
dough three parts flour one part water a
little salt some sugar in this one and
couple teaspoons of yeast you just mix
it and let it sit for an hour and at the
end of that time you shape it into
little balls let those rest for a few
minutes and then flour a board liberally
I would say meanwhile your grills going
because we are grilling these flour this
board and roll them out you don't have
to roll them too big because you want
them to be the technical term is poufy
add flour if you need to and don't if
you don't and as you finish rolling out
one you can start grilling it and roll
out the next you just need a little bit
of olive oil just enough to give it a
little glaze flip that up onto the grill
a little more oil move on to the next
these are great and right off the grill
hot but they're fine an hour later at
room temperature they're fine three
hours later for that matter but they're
a treat when they're warm first one is
probably ready to turn you can see
nicely bubbled you'll know it's ready to
turn when it turns easily once it's not
sticking look at that nice that was
maybe a minute I'd give it a tiny bit
more olive oil just sprinkle it with
some zatar which is a Middle Eastern
spice mix of cumin sesame seeds and
sumac which you can buy bottled as zatar
or make your own you saw how I let that
sit for a minute I didn't touch it I
turned it when it was ready and as a
result got these beautiful grill
marks on it they really won't turn that
easily until they're ready to turn but
you can always peek okay that's you know
you can you can live with those but you
can get nicer grill marks than that also
these are very forgiving very very easy
so our first one is pretty much done
beautiful you may like more grill marks
less grill marks anything short of
burning it is fine like if it catches
fire you know you're too late these are
going to be great wrapped around
skewered and lamb or fish other meat
with vegetables a yogurt sauce at the
heaney sauce to use these as you would a
sort of non pocket pita fabu trying to
decide which one to eat
great has
the thin huy toughness of pizza it's
also very light and obviously not
covered with stuff there was nothing
better than grilled bread
